lines.text: [at the Deardens' party, the guests are discussing the ongoing murder trial at which Sir Alan is the prosecuting attorney]
My dear, I was at the trial today. Alan was thrilling! How he made that murderer squirm!
[she chooses an hors d'oeuvre from the tray offered by the waiter]
All the fellow did was to push his wife off a cliff.

[as Lord Henry moves to take a canapé, Lady Agatha stops him]
Henry!
[Sir Alan approaches]
Oh, Alan, I was so proud of you today. How long will it take you to finish that little wretch?
The trial may take another week.
A whole week?
[chuckling while stuffing her face]
I mustn't miss a single day!

[softly]
Excuse me, please.
[leaves]
Why is everybody so vicious about this fellow? After all, perhaps his wife *needed* murdering.
Well, if you think that's funny, I don't!
[leaves in a huff]

[following his wife]
My dear, my dear, it wasn't meant for you.

[to Bunny]
Cocktail, sir?
Lady Hathaway would have made a most charming cannibal. Can't you see her dancing 'round the pot while the victim boils?
Well, anyway her morbidity is honest.
Now look here, Bunny, you're a pretty good lawyer. At least, you would be if you hadn't so much money.

[Holding baby]
He's so soft. Don't babies have any bones?
